Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian pottery Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black (fired red) below; two added white bands; exterior: narrow brown band on top of rim, reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (according to Ashmolean Museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Many kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 170, no. 219)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 735, no. 956)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1881) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
